revised_title: Investigating the Effect of Heat on Contagium in Two Forms of Septichsemia
tldr: The author conducts experiments to determine the effect of heat on contagium in two forms of septichsemia, known as Davaine's and Pasteur's. The results show that superheating the exudation fluid eliminates the infectivity, suggesting that the microorganisms found in the disease may not be the cause of the infection.
